channel.title: [PI] need some real help NPCdrops.TSM/ from good coder [PI]
channel.description:
wow? i didnt know my question was that hardd =/ ive looked on google, + everything.. but everyones stuck??
how would i make it to where something drops everytime, but rare'r items dont? like ashes 100%/ and 3%claws or something?? Some people say top row = common, bottom = rare and other say its the opposite? which one? this is a [pi] under NPCdrops.TSM .. + this is what i hear below
#Lesser Demon <-----name 82:30 995:1300 15039:1 15040:1 <-- idk
[NPC ID] : [rarity] --tab-- [item id] : [item quantity] --then put all the items that you want?? but its wierd cuz its an or. like if you have 2 things, its 1 or the other? and idk what bottom row is. I put a code in the bottom/compile/restart and it drops at the same rate as the top? --can someone that knows what their doing help? i know a lot of people are stuck on this =/ -thanks

item.title: [PI] need some real help NPCdrops.TSM/ from good coder [PI]
item.dc:creator: @MegaGreen MegaGreen
item.description:
@MegaGreen wrote:

Heh, you posted this over a month ago and nobody posted back? Can’t stand that… I registered to this forum just right now to help you.

100% drops are not in NPCDROPS.TSM

They are located in: NPCCONSTANT.TSM

Now then… I’m going to explain the full thing…

#Man drops (For example - Whats shown here is everything he will have 1% at ever dropping)
NOTE: If you have one item/rarity he seems to NOT drop anything! So do not go by this one alone!!!)
1:1 995:100 554:100

If we want him to drop items of a different rarity, you can just add more lines!
(We’ll use bronze sword for example. (Item ID: 1277))

#Man drops
1:1 995:100 554:100
1:50 1277:1

Now they have a 50% at dropping bronze swords too and he will drop 1 of them when the time comes, and it basically causes a clash I suppose… 50% to bronze sword to 1% either the fire runes or the money and 49% him dropping nothing.

Now then… How NPCconstants.TSM works…

You open it… And all you see is 1-4 lines vertically. We’ll use Level-2 Man (ID: 1) again as an example…

1 526

Quite simple, right? No % or anything needed! He will always drop 526 (Regular bones)

Also, as a bonus tip… We know Dragons drop bones and hides…

Thats where the line amounts go up, you just press ‘tab’ and add more items.

Hopefully after this time you get a chance to read this and still have use of it.

[P.S. To potential flamers, I didn’t use the code option cause this was all metaphorical. Its answered now for everyone to see]

Read full topic
item.source: [PI] need some real help NPCdrops.TSM/ from good coder [PI]
